description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY PART SIDE/ REAR AND SINGLE STOREY PART REAR EXTENSION AND CONVERSION OF ROOFSPACE TO HABITABLE USE INVOLVING INSTALLATION OF A REAR DORMER.
decision_conditions: The proposed two storey side extension, by reason of its size, siting, excessive width, subordinate and angled raised crown roof design, fenestration details, would represent an incongruous addition to the side of this terraced house, detracting from the architectural composition of the original house and terrace, thereby unbalancing its appearance. It would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of this part of the Hayes Village Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to BE4, BE13, BE15 and BE19 of the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (September 2007) and section 5.0 of the Hillingdon Design & Accessibility Statement (HDAS): "Residential Extensions".

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (September 2007) set out below, and to all relevant material considerations, including Supplementary Planning Guidance:
BE4	New development within or on the fringes of conservation areas
BE13	Layout and appearance of new development
BE15	Alterations and extensions to existing buildings
BE19	New development within residential areas - complementing and improving amenity and character of the area
BE21	Siting, bulk and proximity of new buildings/extensions
BE22	Residential extensions/buildings of two or more storeys
BE23	External amenity space and new residential development
BE24	Design of new buildings - protection of privacy
AM14	New development and car parking standards.
London Plan (2004) Policy 4A.7: Energy efficiency and renewable energy.
